text: McVey: PM needs a 'dignified departure'
author: JPonpolitics

text: “We’re completely without a government at the moment” says Labour's Shadow Transport Secretary @AndyMcDonaldMP
author: JPonpolitics

text: Brexiteers shouldn't be labelled "rebels" argues @EstherMcVey1 "The rebels are the 75% of remain voting MPs".
author: JPonpolitics

text: I'll be joined by Health Minister Steve Brine, shadow cabinet minister @AndyMcDonaldMP , Esther McVey and more.
author: JPonpolitics

text: Morning! Coming up on Pineaar's Politics at 10 on @bbc5live I'll be joined by pundits @GeoffNorcott  @janemerrick23 and @SebastianEPayne
author: JPonpolitics

text:
A second referendum would be "deeply damaging" says @JennyChapman;

"There is more than one way to ruin your country. Yes there is economic damage that can be done, there is another kind of damage too around division and lack of confidence in politics”.
author: JPonpolitics

text: "Theresa May resigning would not help to get a deal through; "The amount of respect for the PM in the country is incredible....You can see that she is steadfastly focused on what is in the national interest” - @MattHancock
author: JPonpolitics

text:
Health Secretary @MattHancock says he is positive about post Brexit Britain;

“In many ways it is a great time to be alive there is great enormous opportunities around the world. The technological developments, the extraordinary growth of the east – we can be part of all that"
author: JPonpolitics
JPonpolitics

text:
Lord Charlie Falconer:

"There's a lot of anxiety in the Lords over the leadership of the Labour Party, and there's a lot of people, I expect, toying with whether they're staying or not."
author: JPonpolitics

text:
Lord Charlie Falconer on taking up a new role looking at Labour anti-semitism cases:

"If [Chris Williamson] hadn't been suspended I think it would have been impossible, so probably I wouldn't, but he was suspended and that was a signal."
author: JPonpolitics

text:
BBC RADIO 5 LIVE NOW 

I'm about to speak to Lord Charlie Falconer, who has been appointed by the Labour Party to conduct a review into how anti-semitism cases are handled.
author: JPonpolitics
JPonpolitics

text: My latest blog is about Chris Grayling's record of mishaps:
author: JPonpolitics

text:
"He doesn't think antisemitism is racist. He doesn't think we're a race... he is much more interested in the plight of the Palestinians than he is in the plight of anyone in this country."

@maureenlipman on Jeremy Corbyn
author: JPonpolitics

text:
"Tom Watson apologised to me about the antisemitism in his party, at a train station, I was very grateful for that."

@maureenlipman
author: JPonpolitics

text:
"We all know that http://Leave.EU  is running an online campaign, I'm actually front and centre of some of their adverts. But they're not part of the Conservative Party. If members behave in a way that is abusive or bullying, we will deal with it."

@BrandonLewis
author: JPonpolitics

text:
"I'm very much of the view that we can get a deal, and a solution to the backstop, that will secure a majority in parliament."

Conservative Party Chairman @BrandonLewis
author: JPonpolitics

text:
"We've said to break the [Brexit] deadlock we're going to have to now start think about moving towards a public vote... that will mean amendments coming up." Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell

@johnmcdonnellMP @bbc5live
author: JPonpolitics

text:
"In my view they resign automatically by voting against the government... you cannot have it both ways, you cannot be in the government and against the government."

@Jacob_Rees_Mogg on pro-EU cabinet ministers threatening to vote to delay Brexit
author: JPonpolitics
